Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Cup
Description: Dish with a wide mouth, a simple cut lip and a rounded bottom. The clay, oxidised on the surface, has been burnished with a pebble - the marks are still visible under the slip. The colour of the surface varies from brick-red to orange-beige. The black colour of the interior surface barely continues on to the exterior of the lip. This bowl is typical of Nubian productions during the Second Intermediate Period.
